intro: Satureja cypria, commonly known as Cyprus savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features small, pink or white flowers. Its leaves are fragrant and have a peppery, slightly minty aroma, making it a popular herb in traditional cuisines. Satureja cypria thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats.
